interface.name: jsx3.xml.CDF
interface.text:
Mixin interface that provides methods for accessing and manipulating an XML document in CDF schema.
Classes that implement this interface must also define a getXML() method. This interface uses that method to access the XML document for which it provides a CDF interface.

nested.name: jsx3.xml.CDF.Document
nested.text: A subclass of jsx3.xml.Document that implements the CDF interface.

method.name: adoptRecord

param.name: strSourceId
param.text: either the id of the source object or the source object itself.

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record in the source object to transfer.

param.name: strParentRecordId
param.text: the unique jsxid of an existing record. If this optional parameter is provided, the adopted record will be added as a child of this record. Otherwise, the adopted record will be added to the root data element.

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: forces suppression of the insert event

method.text:
Transfers a CDF record from another object to this object. If no XML data source exists yet for this object, an empty one is created before adding the new record. This method always updates the on-screen view of both the source and destination objects.
This method fails quietly if any of the following conditions apply:
there is no object with id equal to strSourceId
there is no record in the source object with jsxid equal to strRecordId
strParentRecordId is specified and there is no record in this object with jsxid equal to strParentRecordId
the this object already has a record with jsxid equal to the record to adopt

method.name: adoptRecordBefore

param.name: strSourceId
param.text: either the id of the source object or the source object itself.

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record in the source object to transfer.

param.name: strSiblingRecordId
param.text: the unique jsxid of an existing record in front of which the record identified by strSourceId will be placed

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the deleted record.

method.text:
Equivalent to adoptRecord, except that the to-be relationship is as a previousSibling to the CDF record identified by the parameter, strSiblingRecordId
This method fails quietly if any of the following conditions apply:
there is no record with a jsxid equal to strSourceId
there is no record in the source object with a jsxid equal to strRecordId
strSiblingRecordId is specified and there is no record in this object with a jsxid equal to strParentRecordId
this object already has a record with jsxid equal to the record to adopt

method.name: convertProperties

param.name: objProps
param.text: the properties repository to query.

param.name: arrProps
param.text: if provided, these attributes are converted rather than the default set of attributes.

param.name: bUnion
param.text: if true, arrProps is combined with the default set of attributes and those attributes are converted.

method.text: Converts all attributes in this CDF document that are property keys of the form {key} to the value of the property.

method.name: deleteRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record to remove.

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the deleted record.

return.text: the record removed from the data source or null if no such record found.

method.text: Removes a record from the XML data source of this object.

method.name: deleteRecordProperty

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record to modify.

param.name: strPropName
param.text: the name of the property to remove from the record.

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the deleted property.

method.text: Removes a specific property from a record. If no such record exists in the XML document, this method fails quietly.

method.name: getRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record to return.

return.text: the object representation of a CDF node or null if no such record found.

method.name: getRecordIds
method.text: Returns an array containing all CDF IDs (jsxid) of this CDF.

method.name: getRecordNode

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record to return.

return.text: the record node or null if none exists with a jsxid attribute equal to strRecordId.

method.text: Returns a record from the XML data source of this object. This returned value is a handle to the record and not a clone. Therefore, any updates made to the returned value with update the XML document of this object. To reflect such changes in the on-screen view of this object, call redrawRecord(strRecordId, jsx3.xml.CDF.UPDATE); on this object.

method.name: getSchema
method.text: Returns the schema for this CDF control as set by setSchema(), the first child of this object of type CDFSchema, or the default CDF schema.

method.name: insertRecord

param.name: objRecord
param.text: a JavaScript object containing property/value pairs that define the attributes of the XML entity to create. Note that most classes that implement this interface require that all records have an attribute named jsxid that is unique across all records in the XML document. All property values will be treated as strings. Additionally, the following 3 characters are escaped: " > <.

param.name: strParentRecordId
param.text: the unique jsxid of an existing record. If this optional parameter is provided and a record exists with a matching jsxid attribute, the new record will be added as a child of this record. Otherwise, the new record will be added to the root data element. However, if a record already exists with a jsxid attribute equal to the jsxid property of objRecord, this parameter will be ignored. In this case adoptRecord() must be called to change the parent of the record.

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the additional record.

return.text: the newly created or updated entity.

method.text: Inserts a new record into the XML data source of this object. If no XML data source exists yet for this object, an empty one is created before adding the new record. If a record already exists with an id equal to the jsxid property of objRecord, the operation is treated as an update, meaning the existing record is completely removed and a new record with the given jsxid is inserted.

method.name: insertRecordBefore

param.name: objRecord
param.text: a JavaScript object containing property/value pairs that define the attributes of the XML entity to create. Note that most classes that implement this interface require that all records have an attribute named jsxid that is unique across all records in the XML document. All property values will be treated as strings. Additionally, the following 3 characters are escaped: " > <.

param.name: strSiblingRecordId
param.text: the unique jsxid of an existing record before which the new record will be inserted.

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the additional record.

method.text:
Creates a new CDF record and inserts it into the CDF data source of this object, before the record identified by strSiblingRecordId.
This method fails quietly if any of the following conditions apply:
there is no existing record with a jsxid equal to strSiblingRecordId
there is an existing record with jsxid equal to objRecord.jsxid

method.name: insertRecordNode

param.name: objRecordNode
param.text: an XML element of name record. Note that most classes that implement this interface require that all records have an attribute named jsxid that is unique across all records in the XML document.

param.name: strParentRecordId
param.text: the unique jsxid of an existing record. If this optional parameter is provided and a record exists with a matching jsxid attribute, the new record will be added as a child of this record. Otherwise, the new record will be added to the root data element.

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the additional record.

method.text: Inserts a new record into the XML data source of this object. This method is the same as insertRecord() except that its first parameter is of type jsx3.xml.Entity rather than Object.

method.name: insertRecordProperty

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record to modify.

param.name: strPropName
param.text: the name of the property to insert into the record.

param.name: strPropValue
param.text: the value of the property to insert.

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the inserted property.

method.text: Inserts a new property into an existing record with jsxid equal to strRecordId. If the property already exists, the existing property value will be updated. If no such record exists in the XML document, this method fails quietly.

method.name: redrawRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record to redraw.

param.name: intAction
param.text: INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE.

method.text: An abstract method that must be implemented by any class that implements this interface. Implementations of this method should redraw the specified record in the on-screen view.

method.name: reloadFromSource

param.name: bSystem
param.text: if true, the document will be removed even if this is a system-owned document

method.text: Removes this object's existing document from the cache and reloads the document from its original source. This method is different from the method resetData() in that this method does not reset the XML document of this object to an empty CDF document.

method.name: resetData

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the inserted property.

method.text: Resets the XML of this control to the value returned by CDF.newDocument() and places the document in the server cache.

method.name: setSchema
method.text: Sets the schema for this CDF control.

method.name: getKey
method.text: Generates a unique jsxid attribute for a CDF record. This method can be used for new CDF records when there is no natural unique key to assign to them.

method.name: getVersion
method.text: Returns the release/build for the class (i.e., "2.2.00").

method.name: newDocument
method.text: Creates a new XML document that represents an empty CDF document. The XML source of the new document is <data jsxid="jsxroot"/>.
